newsitem.title: ESTONIA: ESTONIA-ESTONIA FAIRS, KLEMENTI APPLY TO BOURSE.
newsitem.headline: ESTONIA-ESTONIA FAIRS, KLEMENTI APPLY TO BOURSE.

text.p: Estonian Fairs and Estonia's clothing company Klementi last week handed in their applications to list their shares on the Tallinn stock exchange, the bourse listing manager said on Monday.
"Estonian Fairs wants to list its shares on the main list and Klementi on the secondary list," listing manager Rain Semper said to Reuters.
Estonian Fairs shares are currently traded on the free market of the stock exchange while Klementi shares are traded only on the OTC market.
"I cannot say when the listing will take place," Semper added. The companies still need to hand in some additional documents, he said.
Estonian Fairs made a net profit of 6.5 million kroons last year and Klementi had a net profit of 4.3 million kroons.
